text: Katalin Szőke (17 August 1935 – 27 October 2017) was a Hungarian swimmer. She competed at the 1952 Olympics and won two gold medals, in the 100 m and 4 × 100 m freestyle events. She was born in Budapest. During her career Szőke set four world records.Katalin Szőke . sports-reference In 1985 she was inducted into the International Swimming Hall of Fame."KATALIN SZOKE (HUN) - 1985 Honor Swimmer" - International Swimming Hall of Fame (Retrieved on 4 May 2008) Szőke died on 27 October 2017 in Los Angeles, California at the age of 82.Gyász: elhunyt Szőke Kató, Helsinki kétszeres olimpiai bajnoka ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Hungarian swimmers Category:Olympic gold medalists for Hungary Category:People from Brussels
title: Katalin Szőke
